image.altText: Women sitting stares toward into distance, with trees and building in background.

props.synopsis: Survivors of institutional childhood sexual abuse have launched a class action against one of Australia's most prominent sexual abuse law firms, which they say failed to obtain proper compensation from the institutions responsible for their abuse.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivors turn on their lawyers, alleging negligence in class action lawsuit

image.altText: An Indigenous woman with long, silver hair stands in front of a rocky beach.

props.synopsis: The First Nations people of the Eyre Peninsula are threatening legal action against SAWater to stop the construction of a desalinisation plant they say will cause "insurmountable damage" to fish traps that predate colonisation.

title.children: First Nations group threatens to sue SAWater over $313m desalination plant scheme

image.altText: A woman holds a medical syringe and a small bottle labelled "Coronavirus COVID-19 vaccine"

props.synopsis: A South Australian government employee who fell ill after getting a mandatory COVID vaccine has won compensation against his employer.

title.children: Tribunal orders compensation for SA government employee who developed pericarditis after COVID jab

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: The record high tops the August 2021 record, and reinforced expectations of RBA rate cuts in the second of half of 2024.

title.children: Australian share market surges to an all-time high, lifted by lower than expected inflation data

image.altText: Dozens of tractors, harvesters and trucks lined the street outside the Renmark Hotel on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Growers in Australia's largest wine grape producing region are calling for more government support, along with a mandatory code of conduct, to ensure the sustainability of their industry, as many let their fruit rot due to below-cost prices.

title.children: Wine grape growers drive tractors through Riverland streets in protest against below-cost prices

image.altText: Workers make dog treats at a factory in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Inflation comes in lower than expected, with prices rising just 0.6 per cent over the December quarter and 4.1 per cent over the past year.

title.children: Inflation may be falling fast with rates set to follow, but people like Ash and Rebecca are still struggling

image.altText: A young girl lays on hospital bed with green body cast with stars, she holds a white teddy bear with a matching green cast.

props.synopsis: Monique was the first patient in SA to receive a full-body cast for treatment of scoliosis. After three years, she can finally take it off, but there are still challenges ahead.

title.children: For three years, Monique hasn't been able to scratch, swim or shower — until now

image.altText: Man wearing a white business shirt with his arms folded.

props.synopsis: A New South Wales Greens MP says many documents relating to Sydney Metro contracts remain privileged despite to highly paid contractors at the centre of allegations relating to the project being replaced.

title.children: Highly paid Sydney Metro contractors 'replaced' in wake of 'serious' allegations

image.altText: Imran Khan wearing a black shirt speaks as he raises his left hand up palm upwards

props.synopsis: Khan and his wife had been accused of retaining and selling state gifts when the former premier was in power.

title.children: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan and wife sentenced to 14 years in prison for corruption

image.altText: Police tape marks off the boat of a police boat.

props.synopsis: A teenager is charged with manslaughter and three others with aggravated robbery following a 27-year-old man's drowning during an alleged attempt to steal a handbag.

title.children: Teen charged with manslaughter over man's drowning during alleged robbery

image.altText: Composite image of Drake looking sad and a phone screen with the tiktok app open

props.synopsis: Songs by Taylor Swift, Drake, Billie Eilish and more could vanish from the platform after one of the world's biggest record labels slammed TikTok over "bully" tactics in an open letter.

title.children: Universal Music Group pulls music from TikTok, citing 'bullying' and 'bad deal' for artists

image.altText: Federal education minister Jason Clare speaking at a press confernce in Perth

props.synopsis: The agreement is the first of eight that need to be negotiated with state and territory governments this year.

title.children: Minister eyes deal to fully fund public schools across country after landmark WA agreement

image.altText: Celeste Manno smiles happily in a selfie.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Supreme Court hears the obsessive stalker is likely to re-offend if he is ever released back into the community.

title.children: Celeste Manno's 'unprovoked' murder in the 'worst category of offending', court told

image.altText: Sydney woman Lauren O'Neill in a priofile photo

props.synopsis: Lauren O'Neill also expressed gratitude for her "heroic and very kind neighbours" who stepped in after she was bitten on the leg by a shark on Monday.

title.children: Woman bitten by shark in Sydney Harbour thanks 'heroic' neighbours

image.altText: Front steps of the Commonwealth Law Courts in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Cassie is one of hundreds of claimants to sign up for a landmark class action against five state child protection departments.

title.children: 'My whole life was pulled apart': Complaint filed against child protection department, with class actions to follow

image.altText: Composite of two mazda cars.

props.synopsis: The fault affects the gear set within the power steering assembly and increases "the risk of an accident causing injury or death", the recall notice says.

title.children: Thousands of Mazda cars recalled over a potentially deadly manufacturing defect

image.altText: A bright orange sunset over the ocean.

props.synopsis: The temperature has reached 44 C in some parts of Perth — 5 C more than forecast — as the city swelters through another summer heatwave.

title.children: Schools without power, tradies sent home, trains slowed as Perth swelters through summer heatwave

image.altText: Singleton Station fence

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory Supreme Court has dismissed a challenge over whether the NT government acted lawfully when it awarded one of the largest groundwater licences in Australia's history.

title.children: NT Supreme Court dismisses legal challenge over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences

image.altText: A man in a suit.

props.synopsis: The woman complainant cried as she rejected suggestions she instigated oral sex in the pub cubicle or that Mr Beale had been given her consent before the alleged assault.

title.children: Woman denies flirting with Kurtley Beale before alleged sexual assault at Bondi Beach hotel

image.altText: A baby in a pink jumpsuit lies on a bicycle

props.synopsis: Hamas said the proposed deal would see the group first release men, children, the elderly and wounded while humanitarian delivery would resume in Gaza.

title.children: Hamas studies ceasefire deal, hope for hostages and humanitarian aid to resume

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wearing suit stands in front of flag of Israel

props.synopsis: The biblical story of Amalek was invoked by Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu following the October 7 Hamas attack. South Africa says this is evidence of genocidal intent. But who were the Amalekites, and why is this relevant to the ICJ case?

title.children: Why a biblical story is central to South Africa's ICJ case against Israel

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT's former top prosecutor asks a court to consider Walter Sofronoff's hours of conversations with journalists while he was in the middle of conducting an inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Head of inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution made 65 phone calls to journalists during proceedings, court hears

image.altText: Tall white cloud walls look like a stadium.

props.synopsis: Each year, a team of scientists flies directly into the eyes of some of the world’s biggest storms as they try to solve one of meteorology's greatest forecasting fears — the rapid intensification of life-threatening hurricanes and cyclones.

title.children: As pilots bring this plane up to the wall of the hurricane, it starts to shake like 'an old wooden rollercoaster'

image.altText: Fuzzy sonar vision of what looks like the shape of a plane from a bird's eyeview.

props.synopsis: After countless searches for Amelia Earhart's plane, Deep Sea Vision's sonar images may be the latest clue for solving the decades-old mystery.

title.children: Deep sea explorers believe they've captured a sonar image that could unravel one of aviation's greatest mysteries

image.altText: composite image of Ross Knight of Cosmic Psychos, Debbie Harry of Blondie, and Brian Molko of Placebo

props.synopsis: The first Pandemonium Festival is set to take place in walking distance of the RSL NSW commemorative service on Anzac Day.

title.children: 'Anzac Day is not for sale': RSL NSW pushes back on clash with rock music festival

image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: A 10-month investigation into Tasmania's harness racing industry has found individuals within the industry engaged in team driving, race fixing and animal abuse.

title.children: 'Dark day for Tasmania's harness racing': Long-awaited report makes findings of race fixing, animal abuse

image.altText: Powerlines silhouetted by the sun.

props.synopsis: Queensland’s state-owned power grid quietly forced almost 170,000 air-conditioners in homes and businesses into low-power mode six times over summer.

title.children: Almost 170,000 air conditioners remotely turned down six times during blistering summer heat

image.altText: A house sits in high flood waters.

props.synopsis: More than 300,000 claims were lodged after the 2022 floods, but consumer groups say that is no excuse for what has been described as "appalling behaviour" by the insurance industry.

title.children: Insurance industry slammed for 'rude, aggressive, bullying behaviour' by consumer groups during flood response inquiry

image.altText: A one-story restaurant in the suburbs is badly damaged after a fire

props.synopsis: Police have arrested two men in their 20s over a suspicious fire that destroyed the Burgertory outlet in Caulfield, while saying the incident "wasn’t motivated by prejudice or politics".

title.children: Two men arrested over blaze that destroyed Melbourne burger shop, police refute 'hate crime'

image.altText: Figurines of travellers walking with bags, in front of a large Booking.com logo in a photographer's illustration.

props.synopsis: Australia's consumer rights watchdog sees a sharp increase in Australians citing the popular accommodation site when reporting they've been scammed.

title.children: Travellers and accommodation providers falling victim to major Booking.com scam

image.altText: A koala relaxes in the branch of a tree, stretching his claws

props.synopsis: Koalas are one of the world's most beloved animal species, but Australians haven't always felt this way, writes Ruby Ekkel.

title.children: A century ago, Queensland declared open season on koalas, killing 600,000 in a year. The backlash was intense

image.altText: Cody family

props.synopsis: Like many young Australians 26-year-old Cody is struggling with the housing crisis and with dwindling vacancy rates in Perth she, her partner and her friends have landed at her grandmother's place as a last resort as their search continues.

title.children: Rental crisis is hitting young people hard as they seek alternate accommodation

image.altText: Aerial footage of floodwaters at Jandowae

props.synopsis: Damage assessments will be carried out today in parts of southern and south-east Queensland, after days of torrential rain.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily expected to do a U-turn, with 'days of rainfall' to continue for Queensland

image.altText: A group of stockmen stand in a line with one mounted on a horse.

props.synopsis: The historic site of the Wave Hill walk-off — a seminal turning point in Australian history — has allegedly been damaged.

title.children: NT government to launch legal action over alleged damage to National Heritage Listed Wave Hill walk-off site

image.altText: A man in a t-shirt holds a wedge-tailed eagle on his gloved hand in a living room.

props.synopsis: The man accused of killing teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell, who went missing in northern Tasmania last year, pleads not guilty to murder.

title.children: Man accused of murdering Tasmanian teen Shyanne-Lee Tatnell pleads not guilty
